SEARCH
Package socialmedia

Class Platform

java.lang.Object
socialmedia.Platform
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Platform extends Object implements Serializable
Platform stores all data relating to a specific social media platform instance. This includes all accounts, posts, and counters. When the social media platform is saved, the platform class can be serialised to allow this data to persist.

The class also provides methods to retrieve platform statistics, in addition to validity checks.

See Also:

    • checkHandleLegal

      public boolean checkHandleLegal(String handle)
      Method to check whether a handle is legal to create (does not exist)

      Parameters:
      handle - - the handle to determine the legality of
      Returns:
      Returns false if a handle cannot be created (not unique), and true if it is legal to create.

    • checkHandleValid

      public boolean checkHandleValid(String handle)
      Method to check whether a handle is valid. A handle cannot be more than 30 characters, cannot contain whitespace, or be empty (invalid).

      Parameters:
      handle - - the handle to determine the validity of
      Returns:
      Returns false if the handle is invalid, or true if the handle is valid.

    • checkPostValid

      public boolean checkPostValid(String postMessage)
      Method to check whether a post message is valid. A post message cannot be more than 100 characters, and cannot be empty (invalid).

      Parameters:
      postMessage - - the post message to determine the validity of
      Returns:
      Returns false if the post message is invalid, or true if the post message is valid.

    • checkPostActionable

      public boolean checkPostActionable(int id)
      Method to check whether a post is actionable. An actionable post is either a normal post or a comment post (endorsement posts are non-actionable).

      Parameters:
      id - - the ID of the post to check
      Returns:
      Returns false if the post is non-actionable, or true if the post is actionable.

    • getNumberOfAccounts

      public int getNumberOfAccounts()

    • getTotalOriginalPosts

      public int getTotalOriginalPosts()
      Method to determine the number of original posts in the platform. Iterates over all posts, including them in the count provided they have type '0' (normal/original post).

      Returns:
      the number of original posts in the platform

    • getTotalEndorsmentPost

      public int getTotalEndorsmentPost()
      Method to determine the number of endorsement posts in the platform. Iterates over all posts, including them in the count provided they have type '2' (endorsement post).

      Returns:
      the number of endorsement posts in the platform

    • getTotalCommentPosts

      public int getTotalCommentPosts()
      Method to determine the number of comment posts in the platform. Iterates over all posts, including them in the count provided they have type '1' (comment post).

      Returns:
      the number of comment posts in the platform

    • getMostEndorsedPost

      public int getMostEndorsedPost(Platform socialPlatform)
      Method to determine the most endorsed post in the platform.

      Parameters:
      socialPlatform - - the Platform object storing the posts, enables retrieving a post's endorsements (getEndorsements)
      Returns:
      the ID of the post in the platform with the most endorsements. In the case of a draw, the last post in the list is returned (highest ID). In the case there are no posts in the system, -1 is returned.

    • getMostEndorsedAccount

      public int getMostEndorsedAccount(Platform socialPlatform)
      Method to determine the most endorsed account in the platform.

      Parameters:
      socialPlatform - - the Platform object storing the posts, enables retrieving a post's endorsements (getEndorsements)
      Returns:
      the ID of the account in the platform with the most endorsements. In the case of a draw, the last account in the list is returned (highest ID). In the case there are no accounts in the system, -1 is returned.
